text: For my active trading account, not talking about long-term requirement, sort of quasi-passive stuff. For active trading, my philosophy is that you want to be short volatility most of the time. So 80% of my book at any given time will probably be short volatility. When I first started out, I would hang out around the 40 to 60 day window because classically, when you read all the sort of classic option tech, they talk about that being sort of the sweet spot for that sort of shedding of the extrinsic premium or like the theta decay. You'll see that curve and it's right around that time. I've migrated since to 20 days and under, much shorter tenders. One, because the volume is there on the indexes now because everybody is in the super front end of the curve, the term structure. And secondly, because I found that most of the research that you'll find and that you'll do on your own, the highest variance risk premium is in the short date. So because of that, I want exposure to the VRP as often as possible to take advantage of compounding. And I want to get feedback sort of very quickly. And then the other 20%, which has gone up because it used to be 90-10, I've fallen in love with small caps and micro caps. The reason being, one, is there's so many occurrences on a daily basis. And then two, it's like trading a VIX at 60 or 70 almost every day. And so with my exposure with the SPX products and with the SPX products, with the ETPs and stuff like that, it's given me an insight into how to manage risk on volatile stuff. And so when a friend of mine who's a prop trader in Austin, when he introduced, he said, dude, you got to check out these micro and small caps. When I actually looked at it, I said, oh, man, this is the gutter. Like, is this where I really want to trade? But then I looked into it and I'm not a super coder. So like, I couldn't really back test this in Python. I had to kind of do it by hand. But as you would go through, you would see, wow, there's a drift here and it's downward. 99% of the time, it's a good thing. And then you look at the market, and you're like, man, this is where it's at. And so then I was like, man, this is where it's at. And then I was and I was like, I can't tell you how much money I'm spending on this. But my portfolio is going to go down. And I was like, well, it's going to go down. So I added that slowly to my portfolio. And I love it. So those are the two main things. So it's primarily shorting. However, after collecting a lot of data and looking at it, there are times, there are special situations where I will get long, these small caps and these micro caps too. Like I said, it's only with right Right now it's only with 20% of the portfolio, but who knows? I mean, I may increase that to 30% next year because it's amazing how strong the edge is in that space.
